com.vaadin.polymer.app

Interface AppDrawerElement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Element, EventTarget, HTMLElement, Node

    @JsType(isNative=true)
public interface AppDrawerElement
extends HTMLElement

    app-drawer is a navigation drawer that can slide in from the left or right.

    Example:

    Align the drawer at the start, which is left in LTR layouts (default):

    <app-drawer opened></app-drawer>

    Align the drawer at the end:

    <app-drawer align="end" opened></app-drawer>

    To make the contents of the drawer scrollable, create a wrapper for the scroll
    content, and apply height and overflow styles to it.

    <app-drawer>
   <div style="height: 100%; overflow: auto;"></div>
 </app-drawer>

    Styling

    Custom property Description Default
    --app-drawer-width Width of the drawer 256px
    --app-drawer-content-container Mixin for the drawer content container {}
    --app-drawer-scrim-background Background for the scrim rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String SRC 
      static String TAG 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the drawer.
      String getAlign()
      The alignment of the drawer on the screen (‘left’, ‘right’, ‘start’ or ‘end’).
      ‘start’ computes to left and ‘end’ to right in LTR layout and vice versa in RTL
      layout.
      boolean getNoFocusTrap()
      Trap keyboard focus when the drawer is opened and not persistent.
      boolean getOpened()
      The opened state of the drawer.
      boolean getPersistent()
      The drawer does not have a scrim and cannot be swiped close.
      String getPosition()
      The computed, read-only position of the drawer on the screen (‘left’ or ‘right’).
      boolean getSwipeOpen()
      Create an area at the edge of the screen to swipe open the drawer.
      double getTransitionDuration()
      The transition duration of the drawer in milliseconds.
      double getWidth()
      Gets the width of the drawer.
      void open()
      Opens the drawer.
      void resetLayout()
      Resets the layout.
      void setAlign(String value)
      The alignment of the drawer on the screen (‘left’, ‘right’, ‘start’ or ‘end’).
      ‘start’ computes to left and ‘end’ to right in LTR layout and vice versa in RTL
      layout.
      void setNoFocusTrap(boolean value)
      Trap keyboard focus when the drawer is opened and not persistent.
      void setOpened(boolean value)
      The opened state of the drawer.
      void setPersistent(boolean value)
      The drawer does not have a scrim and cannot be swiped close.
      void setPosition(String value)
      The computed, read-only position of the drawer on the screen (‘left’ or ‘right’).
      void setSwipeOpen(boolean value)
      Create an area at the edge of the screen to swipe open the drawer.
      void setTransitionDuration(double value)
      The transition duration of the drawer in milliseconds.
      void toggle()
      Toggles the drawer open and close.
